Variables

HValue

Data that needs to be syncronized between components or remote clients should be implemented as HValues.  If client-side validation and type-checking is needed, it should be implemented by subclassing HValue.

Summary
HValue
Data that needs to be syncronized between components or remote clients should be implemented as HValues.
Instance variables
constructor
set
Replaces the data of the value.
get
Return the data, synonymous to the value instance variable
bind
Bind a component to the value, use to attach HValues to components derived from HControl.
unbind
Detach a component bound to this value.
refresh
Calls the setValue method all components bound to this HValue.
toXML
Responsible for generating the xml representation of the value object.

Instance variables

idValue Id, used by the whole value management system to identify individual values.
type’[HValue]’
valueThe container/”payload” data value itself.
viewsA list of Components that uses this value.  Used for automatic value syncronization between components.

Usage example

var myApp = new HApplication(100);
var mySlider = new HSlider(new HRect(100,100,300,118),myApp,1.0,0.0,200.0);
mySlider.draw();
var myValue = new HValue(123,100.0);
myValue.bind(mySlider);

See also

HValueManager HControl

constructor

constructor: function(_id,
_value)

Parameters

_idThe source id (ideally set by server, should be unique)
_valueThe initial data

set

set: function(_value)

Replaces the data of the value.  Extend this, if you need validation etc.

Parameters

_valueThe new data to replace the old data with.

See also

HControl.setValue HValueManager.set

get

get: function()

Return the data, synonymous to the value instance variable

Returns

The value instance variable (the data “payload”)

See also

HValue.value

bind

bind: function(_viewObj)

Bind a component to the value, use to attach HValues to components derived from HControl.

Parameters

_viewObjAny component that is derived from HControl or any class that responds to setValueObj and setValue methods.

See also

unbind HControl.setValueObj

unbind

unbind: function(_viewObj)

Detach a component bound to this value.

Parameters

_viewObjAny component that is derived from HControl or any class that responds to setValueObj and setValue methods.

See also

bind

refresh

refresh: function()

Calls the setValue method all components bound to this HValue.

See also

HControl.setValue

toXML

toXML: function(_i)

Responsible for generating the xml representation of the value object.

Parameter

_iThe sequence number of the item, generated by HValueManager.

Returns

A XML string with meta-info about the object

See Also

HValueManager.toXML

Samples

<hvalue id="996" order="30" jstype="boolean" length="4">true</hvalue>'
<hvalue id="997" order="31" jstype="number" length="7">123.321</hvalue>'
<hvalue id="998" order="32" jstype="object" length="5">1,2,3</hvalue>'
<hvalue id="999" order="33" jstype="string" length="16">&lt;b&gt;Bold Text&lt;/b&gt;</hvalue>'
Generated by Natural Docs
constructor: function(_id,
_value)
set: function(_value)
Replaces the data of the value.
get: function()
Return the data, synonymous to the value instance variable
The container/”payload” data value itself.
bind: function(_viewObj)
Bind a component to the value, use to attach HValues to components derived from HControl.
unbind: function(_viewObj)
Detach a component bound to this value.
refresh: function()
Calls the setValue method all components bound to this HValue.
toXML: function(_i)
Responsible for generating the xml representation of the value object.
Simple value syncronization system.
Abstract foundation class for all active visual components that implement events and values.
setValue: function(_value)
Assigns the object a new value.
set: function(_id,
_value)
Sets a new container value to the HValue object by calling the bound HValue by its id.
setValueObj: function(_aValueObj)
Binds an HValue-compatible instance to the component’s valueObj.
toXML: function()
Outputs all changed values to XML.
